    RegionConnector.java --- Class implementing the IConnector-Interface connecting BWTA.Regions in the graph based on their accessibility to one another.

    P H - 08.03.2018

    • Method Detail

      • addConnectionsToGraph

        public void addConnectionsToGraph(DirectedGraphList graph,
                                  java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,java.lang.Integer> mappedInstances)
        Description copied from interface: IConnector
        Function for adding edges to a provided graph using the provided indices of the mapped T instances. These T instances can be anything, i.e. Regions, ChokePoints, Positions, etc.. As long as a mapped instance exists the reference can be used. This is necessary since the graph that is being used is using an adjacency List which in return uses Integers as an internal representation of its edges.
        Specified by:
        addConnectionsToGraph in interface IConnector<bwta.Region>
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph to which the edges are being added.
        mappedInstances - a HashMap which mapps the used T instances to Integers that can be used to represent vertices and edges in the graph.
